snippet: Hundreds of Uber drivers gathered at the New York headquarters of the ride-sharing service to oppose fare cuts imposed last month, a move the company said lifts demand during slow winter months.
abstract: Hundreds of Uber drivers assemble at ride-hailing service's Long Island City, Queens, headquarters to protest announcement that it is cutting ride prices across country; drivers say cuts will force them to work more hours and pledge retaliation.

byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and JOHN SURICO

lead_paragraph: Hundreds of Uber drivers gathered at the New York headquarters of the ride-sharing service to oppose fare cuts imposed last month, a move the company said lifts demand during slow winter months.

headline.main: Uber Drivers in New York City Protest Fare Cuts
headline.print_headline: Angry About Fare Cuts, Uber Drivers in New York Warn of Reprisals
